name: Rep. Brian Fitzpatrick 🇺🇸
tweet_text: This legislation will strengthen our state courts' abilities to recognize and adjudicate domestic violence and child abuse allegations based on valid, admissible evidence so that courts can enter orders that protect and minimize the risk of harm to children. (6/7)

tweet_text: First, Kathy founded Kayden's Korner, a non-profit with the mission to affect judicial reform of the family court system through the education of domestic abuse signs & the impact of mental illness. And over the past few years, I’ve worked with her in creating Kayden's Law. (4/7)

name: Rep. Brian Fitzpatrick 🇺🇸
tweet_text: A business with a 10% reduction in revenue for one month, who had  no intention to lay off employees, must not be placed into the same category as an owner-operated daycare center with no cash flow and no way to survive.

name: Rep. Brian Fitzpatrick 🇺🇸
tweet_text: It is unacceptable that the @USTreasury and the @SBAgov guidelines had no revenue loss requirements, and only required an attestation that a business was “negatively impacted” by #COVID19.

name: Rep. Brian Fitzpatrick 🇺🇸
tweet_text: All Members of Congress must flag this issue to the @USTreasury and it needs to be fixed immediately. (9/9)

name: Rep. Brian Fitzpatrick 🇺🇸
tweet_text: Businesses that depend on foot traffic and direct in-person contact, like small restaurants, are the businesses that are now insolvent because of this pandemic, and these companies account for nearly 50% of our nation’s workforce. (8/9)

name: Rep. Brian Fitzpatrick 🇺🇸
tweet_text: The @USTreasury must be establish clear requirements that banks prioritize insolvent coffee shop owners over solvent hedge fund owners. (7/9)

name: Rep. Brian Fitzpatrick 🇺🇸
tweet_text: Many larger banks around the country simply prioritized their larger customers with significant banking relationships, taking money away from the small coffee shop owner. This cannot and will not stand. Our small businesses need our help and they need it now. (6/9)

name: Rep. Brian Fitzpatrick 🇺🇸
tweet_text: This has occurred because of ambiguous and insufficient guard rails being established by the @USTreasury with regards to the PPP. (5/9)

name: Rep. Brian Fitzpatrick 🇺🇸
tweet_text: This is money that is literally being taken away from the very small businesses that Congress intended to help, small businesses who have been forced to lay off workers due to insufficient cash flow. (4/9)

name: Rep. Brian Fitzpatrick 🇺🇸
tweet_text: Banks were also receiving applications from businesses that are not small, do not rely on foot traffic and are not insolvent, like hedge funds and brokerage businesses, who in some cases received as much as $10M in forgivable loans. (3/9)

name: Rep. Brian Fitzpatrick 🇺🇸
tweet_text: Round 1 of the PPP missed its target. Banks were receiving applications not just from mom-and-pop small businesses that depend on foot traffic and are barely solvent, like small restaurants, hardware stores and plumbers, whom the PPP was specifically designed to help. (2/9)

name: Rep. Brian Fitzpatrick 🇺🇸
tweet_text: Two things must happen immediately. First, Congress must immediately pass a clean supplement to the #PaycheckProtectionProgram (PPP) by a minimum of $250B. Second, the @USTreasury must immediately fix the PPP to benefit Main Street, not Wall Street. (1/9)
